description: The ORDER_PROC_2 table enables you to report on the procedures ordered in the clinical system. This procedure table has the same basic structure as ORDER_PROC, but was created as a second table to prevent ORDER_PROC from getting any larger.

columns.name: ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure order record.

columns.name: PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the reading physician of the exam.

columns.name: MOD_BEGIN_TM
columns.description: For procedures performed on modalities using Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), this stores the start date & time of the performed procedure sent from the modality to system.

columns.name: MOD_END_TM
columns.description: For procedures performed on modalities using Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), this stores the end date & time of the performed procedure sent from the modality to system.

columns.name: OVERRIDE_TM
columns.description: Stores the most recent time a hard stop was overridden at begin or end exam in radiology

columns.name: RVSN_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The revision reason category number for the order. This depicts the reason that a radiology transcriptionist marked a study as needing revision.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CHANGE_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
The change status reason category ID for the order, which indicates the reason given for reverting an order to a previous radiology status.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Other


Error

columns.name: CHANGE_CMT
columns.description: Stores the comment given for reverting an order to a previous radiology status.

columns.name: STUDY_INSTANCE
columns.description: This column stores the unique identifier for an instance of a DICOM imaging study.

columns.name: CHARGE_TM
columns.description: The date and time a charge was generated by ending a radiology exam.

columns.name: GRP_ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the master procedure record used for grouped imaging orders.

columns.name: ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the radiology result priority.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: BALANCE_ADJ_YN
columns.description:
Stores whether the balance for supplies/drugs is already adjusted.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: IMAGE_LOCATION_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the category ID of the PACS (picture archiving and communication) system has the images for a radiology order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: IMAGES_AVAIL_YN
columns.description:
Stores whether images are available via PACS (picture archiving and communication system) for a radiology order. 'Y' indicates that the images are available, 'N' and NULL indicate that the images are not available.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: PAT_LOC_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the department where the patient is located at the time this order was signed,

columns.name: ACT_ORDER_C_NAME
columns.description:
The active order category ID, which indicates information about the order status.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active Medication


Active Procedure


Discontinued Medication


Canceled Procedure


Completed Medication


Completed Procedure

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LET_EOD_PRNT_DATE
columns.description: The date a letter will be created and printed for this order. This is cleared after the letter has been created and printed.

columns.name: ORDER_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The order source category ID of the order, indicating where in the EHR the order was entered.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Admission Navigator


Transfer Navigator


Discharge Navigator

columns.name: SPECIMN_TAKEN_DATE
columns.description: The date the specimen was taken.

columns.name: SPECIMN_TAKEN_TIME
columns.description: The time the specimen was taken.

columns.name: LET_EXPIRE_USER_ID
columns.description: The ID of the user who marked order as Let Expire.

columns.name: TIME_LET_EXPIRE
columns.description: The time when the physician marked the order as Let Expire.

columns.name: EXP_AFT_START_TIME
columns.description: The date and time an order will be marked as needing review by a physician, based on a defined period of time after the order starts.

columns.name: EXP_BEF_END_TIME
columns.description: The date and time an order will be labeled as expiring, based on a defined period of time before the order's end time.

columns.name: ORD_COPIED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The order copy status category ID, indicating whether the order was copied to another visit.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Not Copied


Copied to Other Encounter


Do not allow Copy

columns.name: REV_ORD_GRANU_YN
columns.description:
Determines if an order is reviewed by day or by instant.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


By Instant


By Day

columns.name: EXP_DAYS_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the amount of time determining when an order will expire is in measured in days or instants. '0' indicates that the expiration time is in a number of hours. '1' indicates the expiration time is in a number of days or weeks.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: REV_ORD_GRANU_YN

columns.name: CHRG_METHOD_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the charge trigger method associated with the order.

columns.name: CHRG_METHOD_ID_CHRG_METHOD_NAME
columns.description: The name of the charge trigger method.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_COMMENTS
columns.description: This free text item is used to store comments about the specimen source.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_RECV_DATE
columns.description: This item stores the date that the specimen was received. It is in the same logical group as the SPECIMEN_RECV_TIME column.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_RECV_TIME
columns.description: This item stores the time the specimen was received. It is in the same logical group as the SPECIMEN_RECV_DATE column.

columns.name: COLLECTOR_IDN
columns.description: The name of the user who collected the specimen for the order.

columns.name: COLLECTOR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the user who collected the specimen for the order.

columns.name: FUTURE_APPROX_DT_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether there is an approximate future expected date for this order. 'Y' indicates there is an approximate future expected date. 'N' or NULL indicates that there is not an approximate future expected date.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: LAST_STAND_PERF_DT
columns.description: The date on which a standing order was last performed.

columns.name: LAST_STAND_PERF_TM
columns.description: The time at which a standing order was last performed.

columns.name: PERFORMING_DEPT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the department where the order was performed.

columns.name: ORIGINAL_ORD_ID
columns.description: When an order record is created as the result of a procedure change workflow, it stores a pointer to the previous order. To reliably find the original order record, refer to ORDER_PROC_5.ORIGINATING_ORD_ID

columns.name: EXTERNAL_ORD_ID
columns.description: Stores the external order ID for the order.

columns.name: REMARKS_HNO_ID
columns.description: Stores the link to the general notes record containing the result remarks. It is networked to General Use Notes record.

columns.name: SER_ADDRESSID
columns.description: Stores the referring provider address ID for referral orders. The format is provider external ID - Address line number. For example, if provider external ID = 123 and Address line = 4, the value would be 123-4. If the referring provider has no address, this will store the provider external ID only.  Other columns in the same logical group are: REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010), REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)

columns.name: REFG_FACILITY_ID
columns.description: Stores the referring facility for referral orders. This is networked to the facility record. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)

columns.name: REFD_TO_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider referred to for a referral order. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010) and REFERRAL_ID (ORD 3300)

columns.name: REFERRAL_ID
columns.description: Stores the associated referral ID for referral orders. Other columns in the same logical group are: SER_ADDRESSID (ORD 3001), REFG_FACILITY_ID (ORD 3010) and REFD_TO_PROV_ID(ORD 3100)

columns.name: LAST_RESULT_UPD_TM
columns.description: The date and time of the last result date. This item is set based on a time stamp received in the interface. It is also set when results are manually entered or when an order is cancelled.

columns.name: COLLECTION_DEPT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the department where the specimen was collected.

columns.name: USER_ID_OF_PROV
columns.description: The unique identifier for the authorizing provider of the order record.

columns.name: LOGIN_DEP_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the login department used by the user signing the order.

columns.name: PERFS_FILED_INST
columns.description: The date and time the order was performed.

columns.name: CHGS_FILED_INST
columns.description: The date and time that charges were filed.

columns.name: NOCHG_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
Contains the reason that no charges were linked to the order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: ORD_PRV_ROUT_MTHD_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores the routing method for the ordering provider


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


In Basket


Fax


Mail


Phone Call


MyChart


Network Printer


Courier Service


Outside Provider Messaging


Print Locally


EDI


Opt Out


E-mail


FHIR


Save to File

columns.name: ORD_PRV_ROUT_ADDR
columns.description: The address of the ordering provider which will be used to receive the results of this order.

columns.name: RIS_SIGN_AGAIN_R_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether multi-discipline studies will be sent back to previous signers for review if the result text has been changed for this order. Yes indicates that studies will be sent back. No or Null will indicate that studies will not be sent back. The data is automatically populated when an imaging study reaches Exam Ended or Exam Begun from the value in field "Sign Again if Result Text Changed" in the Radiology/Cardiology Options 3 screen of the linked procedure. If that is null then we look at the same field in the procedure category or the Study review node of the Imaging System Definitions. Users can change the original value by changing the same field in the advanced mode of the Assign Activity.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IMAGES_AVAIL_YN

columns.name: ABN_WAIVER_SIGN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether an Advanced Beneficiary Notice waiver form was signed by the patient in the event that the service to be performed was denied by Medicare.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: BALANCE_ADJ_YN

columns.name: CHECK_OUT_COMMENT
columns.description: The check-out comments entered on the order.

columns.name: RQG_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of patient and coverage information for non-participatory lab referrals attached to this order.  If this is filled in, then PAT_ID and related columns in the ORDER_PROC table will not be filled in for this order.  This column is frequently used to link to the RQG_DB_MAIN table.

columns.name: SITE_OF_COLLECT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The site of collection category number for the location on patient in which the specimen was drawn.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: LAB_CANCEL_REQ_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who requested to cancel the order.

columns.name: PROTCL_STAT_DT
columns.description: The date an unscheduled order was placed, or the appointment date for a scheduled order which requires a protocol.

columns.name: PROTCL_STATE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The scheduling status for an order which requires a protocol.  This column links to the ZC_PROTCL_STATE table.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Unscheduled


Scheduled

columns.name: LAB_CHG_TRG_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether a charge was triggered in lab.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IMAGES_AVAIL_YN

columns.name: LAB_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order level account record override associated with this order.

columns.name: LAB_COVERAGE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order level coverage record associated with this order.

columns.name: LAB_DONT_BIL_INS_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether insurance should be billed for this order. 'Y' indicates that insurance should not be billed. 'N' or NULL indicates that insurance should be billed.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IMAGES_AVAIL_YN

columns.name: USER_CONTEXT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Assigns an order a category ID with a user's context. The order can be used for or created for procedure orders.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: EFQ_OVRD_DAY_TYPE
columns.description: The items indicate the override values for cycle length and day type (relative vs weekdays). Specifies what the numeric values in the frequency override days columns represent. If it is 1 then the listed days are relative days. If it is 2 then the listed days are weekdays. Any other value has no meaning.

columns.name: EFQ_OVRD_CYCL_LEN
columns.description: If there is a frequency override specified, this item will contain the length of the relative specified frequency cycle (e.g. hours, days)

columns.name: CHART_CORRECTION_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the chart correction audit record for the order.

columns.name: PARENT_CE_ORDER_ID
columns.description: When a cross-encounter order is released, this item stores the ID of the parent order.

columns.name: CONDITIONAL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The inpatient conditional order category ID for the order, indicating whether this order should be conditionally initiated.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes


Yes - Initiated


Force No Condition

columns.name: COND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The inpatient conditional status category ID for the order, indicating whether the conditions for the order to be initiated have been satisfied yet.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Conditions not met


All conditions met

columns.name: INTERFACE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether this order was resulted through an interface or not. Y indicates that the result came through an interface, N indicates it was not resulted through an interface but rather some other result mechanism or not resulted at all.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: CASE_PANEL_NUM
columns.description: The surgical panel that this order is associated with.

columns.name: IS_SAVED_ORDER_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether an order has a status of saved. A "Yes" value indicates that the order is in a status of saved. A null value indicates that the order is not in a status of saved. A "No" value will not be populated for this column.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: IMAGES_AVAIL_YN

columns.name: OVRD_TASK_TEMP_ID
columns.description: Contains the override task template ID for overriddem anchored orders, orders attached to a time (for example, a pregnant woman's delivery date).

columns.name: OVRD_TASK_TEMP_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: This column displays the name of the task template record.

columns.name: SOURCE_OF_PRI_INS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The source of prioritized date category ID for the order record. Prioritized date is determined by the following hierarchy: collection date and time, result date and time, release date and time (for future and standing orders), order date and time, and encounter date.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Encounter Date


Ordering Date


Instant of Instantiation


Result Date


Specimen Collected Date


Refill Hx Date


Exam End Date

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_INST_TM
columns.description: The time and date that is used as the prioritized date.

columns.name: ORDER_QUESN_LIST
columns.description: The list of question records associated with this order.

columns.name: HOME_CARE_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores the type of home care episode the order should create if it is a home care referral order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Obstetrics


Acute Care


Anticoagulation


Transplant


Oncology - Chemotherapy


Oncology - Supportive Care


Oncology - Follow-up


Home Health


Hospice

Traveler

columns.name: SPECIMEN_BARCODE
columns.description: Stores the barcode data scanned during specimen collection.
